item.title: How to Speed Up Your App's API Consumption
item.description:
How to Speed Up Your App's API Consumption

In the process of creating a PHP application you may come to a point when keeping it isolated from remote resources or services may become a barrier in its development. To move along with the project you may employ different API services to fetch remote data, connect with user accounts on other websites or transform resources shared by your application.

item.title: Simultaneuos HTTP requests in PHP with cURL
item.description:
Simultaneuos HTTP requests in PHP with cURL

The basic idea of a Web 2.0-style "mashup" is that you consume data from several services, often from different providers and combine them in interesting ways. This means you often need to do more than one HTTP request to a service or services.

item.title: Deploy Your Own REST API in 30 Mins Using mLab and Heroku
item.description:
Deploy Your Own REST API in 30 Mins Using mLab and Heroku

Chris Chang demonstrates how to use the MEAN stack to rapidly create a RESTful API server and rich web application, which he then deploys to Heroku.

item.title: 10 Best Practices for Better RESTful API
item.description:
10 Best Practices for Better RESTful API

Web APIs has become an very important topic in the last year. We at M-Way Solutions are working every day with different backend systems and therefore we know about the importance of a clean API design. Typically we use a RESTful design for our web APIs.

item.title: What is alphanumeric (alphameric)? - Definition from WhatIs.com
item.description:
What is alphanumeric (alphameric)? - Definition from WhatIs.com

In computers designed for English language users, alphanumeric (sometimes seen as alphameric ) characters are those comprised by the combined set of the 26 alphabetic characters, A to Z, and the 10 Arabic numerals, 0 to 9.

item.title: Advanced Regex Tutorial-Regex Syntax
item.description:
Advanced Regex Tutorial-Regex Syntax

What the (? ... )A question mark inside a parenthesis: So many uses!I thought I would bring them all together in one place. I don't know the fine details of the history of regular expressions. Stephen Kleene and Ken Thompson, who started them, obviously wanted something very compact.

item.title: 40+ Super Useful Chrome Extensions for Software Testing
item.description:
40+ Super Useful Chrome Extensions for Software Testing

Modern browsers like Mozilla Firefox and Google Chrome make your life easy as a software tester. I use both of them from time-to-time but Chrome ends up a winner majority of those times owing to the number of available chrome extensions for software testing. Even on QST, the majority of readers visit using Chrome (approx.

item.title: What Are APIs and How Do They Work?
item.description:

item.title: Linux Crontab: 15 Awesome Cron Job Examples
item.description:
Linux Crontab: 15 Awesome Cron Job Examples

An experienced Linux sysadmin knows the importance of running the routine maintenance jobs in the background automatically. Linux Cron utility is an effective way to schedule a routine background job at a specific time and/or day on an on-going basis. This article is part of the on-going Productivity Tips For Geeks series.
